Package civitas.celestis.graphics.color

Class LinearColor

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Float4
civitas.celestis.graphics.color.LinearColor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Color8, Numeric, FloatVector<Float4>, Vector<Float4>, Packable, Serializable, Comparable<Float4>
public class LinearColor extends Float4 implements Color8
An immutable color capable of linear transition and easy manipulation. This class is designed for linear transition, as decimal places can be represented due to the use of float for each component.

This implementation has 32 bits of precision for storage and manipulation, and 8 bits of precision for output.

See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • TRANSPARENT_BLACK

      public static final LinearColor TRANSPARENT_BLACK
      Transparent black. Since the values are (0, 0, 0, 0), this is often used for clamping operations in tandem with WHITE (which has values of (255, 255, 255, 255)).

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(@Nonnull Color8 c)
      Creates a new color. Copying a LinearColor through this constructor will drop the decimal places of the RGBA components. (it is also slower than LinearColor(LinearColor))
      Parameters:
      c - The color of which to copy component values from

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(@Nonnull Float4 v)
      Compares this color to a vector by the Manhattan magnitude. (the sum of each component's absolutes)

      If the other vector is a color or represents one in vector form, This will effectively compare the sum of the RGBA components.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Float4>
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Vector<Float4>
      Overrides:
      compareTo in class Float4
      Parameters:
      v - The vector to compare to
      Returns:
      0 if the Manhattan magnitudes are equal, 1 if this is larger, -1 otherwise
